page.title: 15WAITROSE - ROMSEY
page.content: During our visit to Waitrose, we were able to ask many questions. We were told that a Mr Waite and a Mr Rose put their names together to make Waitrose Supermarket. The Romsey branch opened in 1970 and about ninety people now work there. Their main competitors are Sainsburys in Lordshill and Carrefour in Eastleigh. We were told that Waitrose may have become very popular for the great variety of goods sold. In 1985, people want very clean food but they also like to choose it for themselves. Waitrose has had a few problems with their car park. Their new system works well but some people still park there when they shouldn't. Building a multi-storey car park might help, but it would probably spoil the Romsey skyline. Waitrose would like to expand in the future because they are short of space
